executive_summary: The patient is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) presenting with an HbA1c of 7.5%, which is above the target of 7.0%. Blood pressure is within normal limits, but lifestyle modifications are needed to improve overall health and diabetes management.

priority_actions: Implement lifestyle changes to improve HbA1c
Consider medication options for better glycemic control

clinical_context.recent_events: No recent episodes of hypoglycemia or DKA

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is 7.5%, indicating suboptimal glycemic control.
interpretation.plan: Implement lifestyle changes and consider medication to improve glycemic control.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level is 2.5, above the recommended target for high-risk individuals.
interpretation.plan: Recommend dietary changes to lower LDL levels.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a low glycemic index diet, limit processed sugars and saturated fats.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control to manage carbohydrate intake.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia.

patient_goals: Achieve HbA1c < 7.0% within the next 3 months.
Reduce LDL to < 2.0 mmol/L in 6 months.
Increase physical activity to moderate levels within 1 month.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c and LDL levels, adjust treatment as necessary.

emr_note: Patient with T1DM presents with HbA1c of 7.5%. Lifestyle modifications recommended, and consideration for insulin therapy discussed.
